title: MURDER SUSPECT CAUGHT IN MEXICO
body:
Wausau authorities say the man wanted in connection with the shooting deaths of his estranged wife and her friend 
has been caught in Mexico and now is in custody with the FBI in San Diego.

WSAU Radio in Wausau reports that Wausau Police Chief William Brandimore notified the station that Da Vang, 28, 
was in custody. Brandimore would release no more information but scheduled a press conference for today.

Vang was wanted in connection with the Jan. 28 shooting deaths of his estranged wife, Jia Yang, 24, and a friend 
Voua Lo Kiatoukaysi, 25.
